verses.plain: Then Job answered and said,

tokens.t: Then Job answered and said,

verses.plain: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

tokens.t: I know
so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

verses.plain: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.

tokens.t: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.

verses.plain: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?

tokens.t: wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened
against him, and hath prospered?

verses.plain: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.

tokens.t: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.

verses.plain: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.

tokens.t: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.

verses.plain: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.

tokens.t: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.

verses.plain: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.

tokens.t: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.

verses.plain: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.

tokens.t: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.

verses.plain: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.

tokens.t: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.

verses.plain: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.

tokens.t: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see
not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.

verses.plain: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?

tokens.t: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?

verses.plain: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.

tokens.t: God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.

verses.plain: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?

tokens.t: How much less shall I answer him,
choose out my words
with him?

verses.plain: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.

tokens.t: Whom, though I were righteous,
would I not answer,
I would make supplication to my judge.

verses.plain: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.

tokens.t: If I had called, and he had answered me;
would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.

verses.plain: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

tokens.t: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

verses.plain: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.

tokens.t: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.

verses.plain: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?

tokens.t: If
of strength, lo,
strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time

verses.plain: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.

tokens.t: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me:
, I
perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.

verses.plain: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.

tokens.t: I
perfect,
would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.

verses.plain: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.

tokens.t: This
one
, therefore I said
, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.

verses.plain: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.

tokens.t: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.

verses.plain: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?

tokens.t: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where,
who
he?

verses.plain: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

tokens.t: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

verses.plain: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.

tokens.t: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle
hasteth to the prey.

verses.plain: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

tokens.t: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort

verses.plain: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

tokens.t: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

verses.plain: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?

tokens.t: I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?

verses.plain: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;

tokens.t: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;

verses.plain: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.

tokens.t: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.

verses.plain: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.

tokens.t: For
not a man, as I
I should answer him,
we should come together in judgment.

verses.plain: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.

tokens.t: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us,
might lay his hand upon us both.

verses.plain: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:

tokens.t: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:

verses.plain: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.

tokens.t: would I speak, and not fear him; but
not so with me.

footnotes.text: Arcturus…: Heb. Ash, Cesil, and Cimah
proud…: Heb. helpers of pride, or, strength
swift…: or, ships of Ebeh: Heb. ships of desire
abhor…: or, make me to be abhorred
any…: Heb. one that should argue
it is…: Heb. I am not so with myself
